pages.title: Color Mixing
pages.text: By just using three base colors, (almost) every existing color can be created.

Mixing gemstone powder together was not very successful. But you have an other idea:$(br)The closeness of your gemstones to nature suggests that nature must be both source and answer!$(br2)Quickly you make a few notes and $(l:general/colored_trees)out tumbled a recipe$(), which looks very promising.

pages.title: Creating brown Pigment
pages.text: You tried and tried. You could not figure out a way to create brown color by mixing your gemstone dust. The closest you came was merely a washed out orange - yuck.$(br)It can't be THAT hard. Like... $(b_brown)dirt is brown$() and it is the most common stuff around.$(br2)There has to be $(l:general/onyx_shards)a way$()...
$(br2)$(br2)(Seriously, look it up! The way we perceive brown is fascinating!)
